p: Brazilian soy, meat, leather and iron ore chains have their main external consumer market in China (ComexVis 2020, Diálogo Chino 2019) and the EU (ComexVis 2020). In the case of meat and leather, both China and EU are exposed to consumption linked to illegal deforestation in the Amazon and Cerrado: more than half of the slaughterhouses that supply China and at least 20% of soy exports and 17% of meat exports to the EU come from land use illicit changes (MacFarquhar et al. 2019; Rajão et al. 2020). Intensive soybean cultivation in the Amazon and Cerrado has created huge production holes within the landscapes of these biomes. Thanks to the agricultural frontier’s pressure, it has also increased GHG emissions, local social conflicts and impacts on food and water security.
